meanings.definition: To discontinue a session of a legislative body without dissolving it.
meanings.sent1: The Prime Minister was proroguing the parliament until further notice.
meanings.sent2: The Speaker of the House prorogued the meeting due to lack of quorum.
meanings.sent3: The cat prorogued its grooming session to chase a butterfly.
meanings.sent4: The sun prorogued its appearance behind the clouds, causing a sudden chill.
meanings.sent5: The teacher prorogued the class, leaving the students confused about their assignment.

meanings.definition: To postpone or defer a decision or action.
meanings.sent1: The company CEO was proroguing the announcement of the new product launch.
meanings.sent2: The judge prorogued the trial to gather more evidence.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel prorogued gathering nuts to play with its friends.
meanings.sent4: The river prorogued its flow, creating a serene pool for swimming.
meanings.sent5: The student prorogued studying for the exam, hoping for a last-minute miracle.

meanings.definition: To extend the duration of a meeting or session.
meanings.sent1: The chairperson prorogued the conference to allow for more discussions.
meanings.sent2: The professor prorogued the lecture to cover additional course material.
meanings.sent3: The clock prorogued its ticking to make the day seem longer.
meanings.sent4: The garden prorogued its blooming season, delighting visitors with more flowers.
meanings.sent5: The chef prorogued the cooking class, teaching advanced techniques to the students.
